snippet: Defenders of the native habitat of the Outer Banks of North Carolina fear that a recent increase in wild horses threatens the coastal ecosystem.
abstract: Advocates for horses and wildlife conservationists are squaring off over the fate of a herd of 140 wild horses on North Carolina's Outer Banks; herd, fenced into a 7,500 acre strip of land, faces a potential genetic collapse due to inbreeding; conservationists argue that the herd taxes the local ecosystem and should not be artificially maintained.
lead_paragraph: Defenders of the native habitat of the Outer Banks of North Carolina fear that a recent increase in wild horses threatens the coastal ecosystem.

headline.seo: Wild Horses’ Fate in Outer Banks Lies in Preservation Clash
headline.main: Herd’s Fate Lies in Preservation Clash
headline.print_headline: Herd’s Fate Lies in Preservation Clash
